thread.section_title: Alexis Sanchez trains with Chile team-mates despite ongoing ankle injury fears – Metro
thread.title: Alexis Sanchez trains with Chile team-mates despite ongoing ankle injury fears
thread.title_full: Alexis Sanchez trains with Chile team-mates despite ongoing ankle injury fears

author: Sean Kearns
title: Alexis Sanchez trains with Chile team-mates despite ongoing ankle injury fears
text:
Alexis Sanchez participated in Chile training on Tuesday (Picture: Getty) Arsenal forward Alexis Sanchez trained with his Chile team-mates today despite ongoing fears that the winger has damaged his ankle ligaments.
The 28-year-old limped out out Arsenal’s 3-1 defeat to West Brom on Saturday and Arsene Wenger revealed his ankle was in a ‘terrible state’ after the loss at the Hawthorns.
Time for a reality check: Arsenal is as good as it's going to get for Mesut Ozil Wenger, 66, feared Sanchez had damaged ankle ligaments in the defeat but Sanchez was desperate to link-up with his international team-mates who face Argentina on Thursday.
Sanchez posted a cryptic Instagram post yesterday which suggested he would risk himself in the game and he trained with the rest of his team-mates today in a further hint that he’ll participate against Argentina.
Sanchez is carrying an ankle injury (Picture: Getty) MORE: Manchester United shortlist Toby Alderweireld and Willian ahead of transfer window
